message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a new deep neural network model and training scheme for text classification, which is a common task in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of Gradual Weight Shift (GWS) method to stabilize training, which is a technique commonly used in machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) models. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for text classification, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision (CV) tasks. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is also a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions that their model can classify various-length texts without preprocessing inputs into fixed length, which is a technique commonly used in neural networks (NNs) and DL models. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a likely sub-category.
